p: One hundred and two patients (n = 102) were enrolled during the period of the study. Among those patients, forty six patients (n = 46) were agitated. Comparing the two groups of patient, agitated patients had higher incidence of infection (p < 0.02) compared to the non-agitated patients. In addition, there was a significant difference type of sedation used (p < 0.001), ventilators free days (p < 0.001) and length of stay.
